info.description:
The Solutions API provides functionalities for persisting and managing app data on ctrlX OS devices.

Usage:

  • Click 'Authorize' to open the 'Available authorizations' dialog.
  • Enter 'username' and 'password'. The 'Client credentials location' selector together with the 'client_id' and 'client_secret' fields as well as the 'Bearer' section can be ignored.
  • Click 'Authorize' and then 'Close' to close the 'Available authorizations' dialog.
  • Try out those GET, PUT, ... operations you're interested in.
info.title: ctrlX OS - Solutions API

get.description:
Since XCR-V-0116, if 'appdata' is specified as configuration, the archive is downloaded from a 
temporary directory which has been provided by a copy task with source and destination
'/solutions/DefaultSolution/configurations/appdata'. See the 'tasks' endpoint for details.

parameters.description: The full path of a configuration's directory whose content is exported. Since XCR-V-0202.
parameters.name: dir

401.description: Not authorized to access this resource

500.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

get.summary: Packs a configuration or a part of it as zip-file

put.description:
Since XCR-V-0116, if 'appdata' is specified as configuration, the archive is uploaded to a 
temporary directory and can then be loaded to the apps using a load task with configurationPath
'/solutions/DefaultSolution/configurations/appdata'. See the 'tasks' endpoint for details.

parameters.description: The full path of a configuration's directory in which the content is uploaded. Since XCR-V-0202.
parameters.name: dir

400.description: The request is incomplete or malformed

401.description: Not authorized to access this resource

500.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

put.summary:
Replaces the content or a part of a configuration with the content of the transferred archive.
If the configuration does not exist, a new one is created.

post.description:
Depending on the action value in the request the created task 
will be asynchonous or synchronous.
Synchronous tasks may timeout before they are finished so 
they should no longer be used.

Asynchronous tasks:
- load_async
- reset_async
- save_async
- copy

Synchronous tasks:
- load
- reset
- save

copy.summary: copy - Asynchronous task to copy configurations

load.summary: load - Synchronous task to load the specified configuration

queryload.summary: load (queryOnly) - Synchronous task to check if system is ready for loading

reset.summary: reset - Synchronous task to reset the appdata configuration by loading an empty configuration

queryreset.summary: reset (queryOnly) - Synchronous task to check if system is ready for reset

save.summary: save - Synchronous task to save to the appdata configuration

201.description:
Created (task created). The Location header must be interpreted as a relative path, even if it is
incorrectly returned as an absolute path (starting with a slash).

400.description: The request is incomplete or malformed

401.description: Not authorized to access this resource

500.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

200.description: OK (object with properties of specified task)

401.description: Not authorized to access this resource

500.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

ResetTaskRequest.summary: reset_async - Asynchronous task to reset app data

SaveTaskRequest.summary: save_async - Asynchronous task to save app data

Unauthorized.description: Not authorized to access this resource

BadRequest.description: The request is incomplete or malformed

InternalServerError.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

active.description: True, if solution is the active solution (among others); otherwise, false.

status.description: Git status of the working directory of the solution

LoadTask.description: Task for loading a specified configuration into the apps

ResetTask.description: Task for resetting the data of the apps

SaveTask.description: Task for saving the data of the apps

id.description: A server generated ID used to identify the task. This ID is unique.

action.description: The action name executed by this task. This has to be inherited and overwritten by the application.

progress.description: Optional progress of the task in percentage.

parameters.description: Optional map of additional parameters required by the request. Should be defined when inherited by an application.

result.description: Optional map reflecting the result of the task. May be empty until task completition. Should be defined when inherited by an application.

TransferTask.description: Handle asynchronous transfer requests, e.g. copy configurations

description.example: This configuration is used to represent a picker

features.description:
Features is not used by the Solutions app and should
not be used by others. It is kept for compatibility.
It will be removed with the next major release (v2.0.0)

units.description:
Units is not used by the Solutions app and should
not be used by others. It is kept for compatibility.
It will be removed with the next major release (v2.0.0)

active.description:
True, if configuration is the appdata configuration; otherwise, false.
This flag is ignored on PUT and POST requests.

ConfigurationMetadata.description:
Configuration metadata contains information about the system context
in which a configuration was created or used.
Configuration metadata are managed by the Solutions app.

modTime.description: Timestamp in RFC 3339 format when the configuration was modified

device.description: Name of the device where the configuration has been saved or loaded

user.description: Name of the logged-in user who has saved or loaded the configuration

apps.description: List of apps which have been enabled while the configuration has been saved or loaded

loadTime.description: Timestamp in RFC 3339 format when active configuration was loaded.

loadResults.description:
Array of the latest load results.
Will be removed with next major version.
Use loadResult instead.

configuration.description: Name of the active configuration inside the solution

git-status.description: Git status of the working directory of the solution

DiffResult.description: The result provided if two filesystem entries are compared.

name.description: The name of the compared filesystem entry.

isDir.description: True if the compared filesystem entry is a directory and may contain other filesystem entries.

type.description:
Describes the difference of a filesystem entry to a compared source.
* `equal` - Entry exists in both sources with equal content
* `different` - Entry exists in both sources but with different content
* `leftOnly` - Entry only exists in the left (origin) source
* `rightOnly` - Entry only exists in the right (compared) source

size.description: Size of the filesystem element in bytes

modified.description: Date of last modification. Timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

readOnly.description: True, if filesystem element is readonly

fileMode.description:
File's mode and permissions of the filesystem element
in symbolic notation of standard unix permissions
such as '-rwxr-xr-x' or 'drwxr-xr-x'.

isContainer.description: True if the filesystem entry is a directory and may contain other filesystem entries

checksum.description:
Checksum if the filesystem entry is a file and the checksum has been requested.
The checksum is computed for the complete file content and may therefore be used to check
if the contents of two files are identical or different.

Problem.description: This document defines a "problem detail" as a way  to carry machine-readable details of errors in a  HTTP response to avoid the need to define new error  response formats for HTTP APIs.

example.title: You do not have enough credit.
example.detail: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. 
This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, 
it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type 
(e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). When this member 
is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. 
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, 
except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content 
negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).
If the response is a diagnostics message, it contains 
the text associated with the mainDiagnosisCode.
title.example: You do not have enough credit.

status.description:
The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the 
origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description:
A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
If the response is a diagnostics message, it contains the text associated with
the detailedDiagnosisCode.
detail.example: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description:
A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.
It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

code.description:
An error code issued by the system that caused the original problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause of the error.

mainDiagnosisCode.description:
The main diagnosis code is issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

detailedDiagnosisCode.description:
The detailed diagnosis code issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the detailed cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
The detailed diagnosis code gives additional information about the cause of the error.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

dynamicDescription.description:
A dynamic description gives detailed information about the occurrence of a problem.
It can change between different occurrences of the same error.

severity.description: Severity of a problem as defined RFC5424 of the Syslog standard, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424

links.description:
Collection of links to fix the problem. E.g. links to online user manual,
to an online community (using tags) or a developer chat (e.g. Slack).

moreInfo.description:
The moreInfo field allows you to add additional information that might be necessary to debug or trace down the cause of an error.
It might also contain information what is needed to resolve the problem.
There are loosely specified fields for specific problems that can be used in these situations, e.g.:
- On a 403 Forbidden error: The moreInfo can contain a field "requiredPermissions" with the required permissions seperated by comma
- On a 402 Payment required: The moreInfo can contain a field "requiredLicenses" with the required licenses seperated by comma

cause.description:
Sometimes a problem might be caused by problems that occure in other components or are the root cause of a problem. In this
case the related problems can be added as a cause. Since it might be possible that multiple components have problems on a single
action, cause is an array. E.g. Loading failed because several components where not able to load the configuration.

DiffResultModified.description: Modification dates of origin filesystem entry (left) and compared filesystem entry (right).

left.description: Modification date of the origin filesystem entry as timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

right.description: Modification date of the compared filesystem entry as timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

Result.description: The overall result of a save or load operation.

problem.title: You do not have enough credit.
problem.detail: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

problem.title: You do not have enough credit.
problem.detail: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

id.description:
A random code which identifies the instance of the save or load operation.
Should be used to tag related log messages.
The value 'nullid' denotes that this result is uninitialized.

configuration.description: The configuration that was saved or loaded.

time.description: Time in RFC 3339 format when the configuration was saved or loaded.

partialResults.description: Partial results provided by the participants of the operation.

ContentDirectory.description: Describes a directory contained in a configuration.

name.description: Name or path of the directory

description.description: Short description of the content or purpose of the directory

App.description: App which was enabled while the configuration has been saved or loaded

appDirectories.description: List of directories owned by the app

LoadResult.description:
The result provided by a participant of a load operation.
Will be removed with next major version (v2.0.0).
Use Result instead.

problem.title: You do not have enough credit.
problem.detail: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

subject.description: The subject of the result (subject = what has been loaded, e.g. motion settings)

PartialResult.description: Result provided by a participant of a save or load operation.

problem.title: You do not have enough credit.
problem.detail: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

phase.description: The phase in which this result was reported.

subject.description: The subject of this result (subject = what has been saved or loaded).

AppDirectory.description: Describes an app directory stored as part of a configuration.

name.description: Path of the app directory in the configuration.

description.description: Short description of the directory content (visible in the Solutions UI).

icon.description: An optional icon representing the app.

permissions.description: Permissions are deprecated and no longer have effect.

scopes.description: Scopes are deprecated and no longer have effect.

copyOnLoad.description: If true, the copy operation is done by the Solutions app; otherwise, by the app itself.

writeProtected.description: If true, the directory is protected against changes through WebDAV or the Solutions UI.

configurationPath.description: The path of the configuration to be loaded, starting from the solutions directory.

queryOnly.description:
If true, only performs the query phase to check if system
is ready for loading the specified configuration.

action.description: * `load_async` - Task for loading a specified configuration into the apps

queryOnly.description:
If true, only performs the query phase to check if system
is ready for resetting the data of the apps.

action.description: * `reset_async` - Task for resetting the data of the apps
* `save_async` - Task for saving the data of the apps

source.description: Path to the source configuration in the format 'solutions/{solution}/configurations/{configuration}'

destination.description: Path to the destination configuration in the format 'solutions/{solution}/configurations/{configuration}'

action.description: * `copy` - Copies the content of an configuration to another location

Configuration_deploy.description:
Deploy is not used by the Solutions app and should
not be used by others. It is kept for compatibility.
It will be removed with the next major release (v2.0.0)
